relation: Great for these types of students

This School is great for people who are willing to try new thing and like to learn hands on. In just about every major there are a lot of hands on group projects. Also, there College of Business is excellent. The also have a lot of clubs that allow you to get experience in your career field.
Be sure to participate in as many extra curricular activities as possible because when you start looking for a job it will look good on your resume.
It is definitely a very affordable University.
Living on campus has been one of the best experiences for me. There is always some event going on.
The classes are very informative; however, you must be willing to put in the amount of work and effort needed to succeed.
pageTitle: Eastern Michigan University (EMU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {888616=When I was living in the dorms back in 2008 the quality was not as good as it is now. I'm glad Eastern has raised the quality life greatly concerning re-decorating, food, quality of furniture etc., 1045728=Study, work hard and have fun. Set your alarm and don't take classes during times you know you have a hard time getting up for 8:30 for example. Participate in events and browse the clubs. Get involved., 975797=Looking for Scholarships to remain in school at Eastern Michigan University is very difficult, for a single white women there are not any scholarships available. I feel frustrated and concerned that I may not be able to finish my last semester of schooling and I will not be able to graduate in 2014 because of financial poverty., 288431=you pay a lot for horrible rooms that have needed to be fixed up since 1970 or so., 1074843=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 911824=I would say if you can live on campus you should. Your much closer to the social aspect of college life and also avoid the living hell it is to find a parking spot on campus. All the dorms actually on campus after 10 o'clock p.m. (might be sooner now, been awhile since I've lived on campus), have somethings called night watch. People sit outside the entrances to the dorms and request to see your student I.D. If you live in that particular door, you'll have a sticker indicating so, if your not a student at Eastern or your not from that dorm you must be signed in. What I mean by on campus dorms are the student housing options that are actually steps away or in the middle of campus (i.e. the freshman dorms, Wise, Buell, etc..) Off campus housing would be the housing options on the outskirts of campus (i.e. Cornell Courts, The Village, etc...) These housing options to not have night watch. The on campus housing and even The Village try to host small events for the students that live in that particular dorm. Nothing major, but small things to past the time. It's crucial to make friends with those in your dorm and the events help you to mingle with your fellow dorm mates and make new friends., 444168=When making friends on campus, you learn that the number one financial reason they came to Eastern Michigan University was of the reasonable cost, which for 'residents' can range per credit hour from $250-520 (depending on course level) and non-residents $750-1000 (depending on course level). Financial cost is something that most usually comes up in conversation, and having friends in class that commute to campus, live on campus, and are either international students attests to, after talking to them, one of the main* reasons they have chosen EMU. Though students should and can heavily place their considerations on choosing an accredited college based on cost, other reasons such as: prestige, location, and accommodations come to mind; by which EMU excels in., 888098=When I was living in the dorms in 2008 the quality of food was not that good, certain places were better to eat at then others to the palate of food choice was low. Now having experienced the food at Eastern the quality has raised.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews John from Southfield, MI 11/26/2009 Reviewer is A past student here. 21 out of 21 people found this review useful. 2 of 256 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Eastern is great for all types. I would recommend this school to anyone. Eastern is a big school with a large student body, yet it maintains a quaint. EMU is also a bit of a commuter school which may be a drawback for some. Tips for prospective students Stay on top of your priorities. Be sure to stay on top of academics and financial aid. Dont be afraid to get involved on campus. Eastern is a place where you can get the most out of your time there by being fully engaged socially and academically. There are a lot of great people attending this school, so you can definitley make some life long friends here. EMU has a impressive library to take advantage of. There are also tons of academic resourses to utilize, that are always accessible if you need help in
